title: For Sale/Trade:  1973 Ruger 10/22 and extras
postcontent:
Looking to either sell or trade my 1973 model Ruger 10/22.  I'm sure everyone is familiar with this model of rifle by now.  This particular one has the shorter of the two available barrel lengths at 16".  Has an all metal trigger assembly, if that is something you're looking for.  The bolt assembly and internal trigger mechanisms have al beenpolished and trigger pull has been smoothed out and is consistent and crisp.  Still has the original hardwood stock and overall the rifle is in great condition, with just the normal nicks and few dings you would expect from a rifle that has been used and is this age.  Mechanically it is perfectly sound and feeds, fires, and ejects flawlessly with every type of ammo I've fed it.  

It comes with two factory ten round magazines, one Ruger bx25 factory 25 round magazine and about 200 rounds of assorted ammo.  Most of that is Remington bulk with some CCI mini mags and Aguila 60 grain subsonic as well.  

Just selling because I'm wanting to consolidate calibers and this rifle needs to be passed to someone who will use and enjoy it.  

Would sell outright or will also trade for any Norinco (Chinese) SKS and I will add another 175.00 for that if it's in good condition.  Will also trade plus 175.00 +/- for any Mossberg 12 gauge with 18 or 20" barrel.  

Hoping to sell before the end of the week.  Will meet FTF in the Concord/Charlotte area or as far north as Lexington.  Can email other pics if needed.  Thanks.

AMERICAN INGENUITY MEETS EUROPEAN REFINEMENT
 The legendary 1911 design has been brought into the 21st century with the refinement today’s shooters demand. The SIG SAUER® 1911 proves that close tolerances equal complete reliability and need not be incompatible in an off-the-shelf pistol. postcontent:
FN6 Ammo. 1000 Rounds 5.45x39mm ammo packed in .50 Cal ammo can. $250

The Soviet 5.45×39mm cartridge is a rimless bottlenecked rifle cartridge. It was introduced into service in 1974 for use with the new AK-74 assault rifle. It gradually supplemented then largely replaced the 7.62x39mm round in service.

Info below from Wikipedia

The 5.45×39mm is an example of an international tendency towards relatively small sized light weight military service cartridges. Cartridges like the Russian 5.45×39mm, 5.56×45mm NATO and Chinese 5.8×42mm allow a soldier to carry more ammunition for the same weight compared to their larger and heavier predecessor cartridges and produce relatively low bolt thrust and free recoil, favouring light weight arms design and automatic fire accuracy.

Has 14 Mags with it,(each mag is european MFR so no asian crap) and about 700 rds of loose fmj ammo.alot of rounds of rock and roll in a wooden crate.

no mag wobble. Rifles finish is a lttle worn, but it is parkerized,my brother used it in conjunction with 20 round mags and softpoint for hunting last year, so there are some scratches in the finish, but I think it has character.

Has an AK carry bag, with 6 mag pockets included.
2 slings included, one is a polish OD nylon poly blend sling, and the one on it presently is a nice supple leather sling from a G3.

The finish is still nice, the internals are excellent! I keep it clean as a whistle. Always cleaned after hunting and range sessions, also cleaned about every 5-6 months when not fired.

postcontent:
This Concealed Carry Training Course, instructed by Louie Katona, is for residents of the State of Ohio who wish to apply for a Concealed Carry License (CHL). Louie has spent 28 years in law enforcement, 30 years as an N.R.A pistol and rifle instructor, is an Ohio concealed weapons instructor having trained over 3,000 civilians in concealed carry, and is a law enforcement trainer in weapons and tactics. Successful completion of this NRA Basic Pistol Class will provide you with the competency examination as described in 2923.125 (G)(2) of the Ohio Revised Code, and the certificate required for an Ohio Resident to obtain their Concealed Handgun License in Ohio.

Power Antenna does not work (it is stuck in the "UP" position and gets reception fine; it just does not go "UP" and "DOWN" when the ignition is turned "ON" and "OFF" respectively).

I am looking for $3200 cash.  I think this is fair because this car, in this condition would easily sell for $2500 w/ 120K miles on it.  I will consider vehicle, motorcycle, and firearms trades as well (may be looking for more trade-wise, but it is negotiable).

I am selling this because I just bought a 2012 Chrysler 200 S and don't really need this.  I would only consider vehicle trades that offer something this doesn't.  That's why I prefer either a Sports Car or Import w/ great fuel economy as a possible tarde.  Firearms trades or Motorcycle trades are always considered!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Beretta 92 and CX4 Storm Carbine
postcontent:
I have an Italian Beretta 92F and a Beretta CX4 Storm Carbine, both chambered in 9mm. Both are in EXCELLENT condition. 

The Italian Beretta has slight holster/slide wear towards the muzzle on one side, but is nothing major. It has also had some trigger work done by a local gunsmith is very good and very well known. Has the best trigger on a Beretta 92 that I've ever felt, but isn't anything that would seem dangerous or feel weird. Just lighter and very smooth. The slide action is like glass or like its on ball bearings. You have to try it to believe it. 

The CX4 Storm Carbine takes the Beretta 92 series mags, and functions flawlessly. It is a completely ambidextrous weapon, all controls can be changed over to either side you choose (lefties will like that). This carbine is very accurate at 50 yards, does fine at 100 yards as well. Recoil is literally nonexistent, you will forget you're shooting the gun except for the sound of it going off. This model has all the rails - one on each side of the forend, one underneath with a vertical foregrip attached, and the one that slides in or out of the frame, below the barrel. It even has the picatinny rail on top, for optics mounting. Included is a higher rise picatinny rail as seen in the picture, with a Target Sports 2X scope that has the red illumination reticle capability (battery powered). All of that alone cost me around $900+ when purchased. 


Between the two weapons I have six 15 round mags, one 10 round mag, one 20 round mag, one brand new unused 30 round mag. All of these are Beretta mags or MecGar, not junk mags. I also have three new 15 round Pro Mags that were given to me, but I don't generally like Pro Mag. You can have them if you wish. 

If purchasing, price can be negotiated within reason.

title: For Sale:  Para Ordnance "PARA TAC" in .45
location: Just North of Indy, Indianapolis, Indiana
postcontent:
I bought this from my brother a few years ago when I was looking for a slightly more compact, concealed carry than my Sig P220. For what ever reason, the hand fit is smaller than I like and it’s been a safe-queen ever since. 
She offers a very health 13+1 rounds of .45 ACP knockdown power. One of the things that I really liked is the extra sight radius from the tactical-length 4.25-inch barrel. Most concealed carry weapons have a much shorter barrel with limited sight advantages. The whole design of this pistol is a true defensive handgun. In addition to the tactical-length barrel, she comes with a flush hammer, bobbed beavertail and rounded back sights. All of these features make for a more concealable, snag-free and easy-drawing package. Would have been the perfect conceal carry weapon for me; except I don’t care for the way it fits in my hand. 
Included with the .45 are (2) OEM Para Ordnance 13 round magazines and a nice Fobus-Paddle holster. Regarding the magazines; knowing my brothers bad habit of fully loading both magazines for extended periods of time, the first thing I did was change out the magazine springs with Wolf heavy duty’s. I’ll include these as well as the originals. I’m asking a very firm $650.00 for her and not in any dire need to sell. If she sells it would be nice, if not she can go sit in my safe for a few more years. 
Please feel free to ask any questions and as shown in my pictures, she is in very nice/clean shape.

title: For Sale:  SW P99
location: Little River, Longs, Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
postcontent:
The .40 caliber SW99 rendition of the popular Walther P99 is a joint collaboration between Smith & Wesson and Walther. The modified receiver used in the SW99 is supplied by Walther and is manufactured in Germany. Smith & Wesson manufactures the slide and barrel of the SW99 in the United States. The SW99 features an internal striker, as opposed to the classical external hammer. The pistol lacks a manual safety; instead a de-cocking button is placed on the top rear section of the slide, which when actuated, places the firearm into double-action mode. This pistol comes with three varying rear grip inserts designed to accommodate various hand shapes and sizes; this feature permits most shooters a comfortable and efficient grip on the firearm.

* Valid CWP required or must be processed through FFL dealer*

     (A bandolier or a bandoleer is a pocketed belt for holding ammunition. It was usually slung over the chest. In its original form, it was common issue to soldiers from the 16th to 18th centuries. This was very useful for quickly reloading a musket.
A somewhat different form of the bandolier came into use in the 20th century when it accompanied modern cartridges and hand grenades. Bandoliers are now rare due to the prohibitive size of modern magazines. They are, however, still commonly used with shotguns, as individual 12 gauge shells can easily be stored in traditionally-designed bandoliers. In fact, some aftermarket shotgun slings are designed in a similar fashion to bandoliers, albeit with a far more limited capacity than true bandoliers.
The bandolier was used to keep ammunition off a soldier's hips, as carrying too much weight on the hips can constrain movement and cause difficulty in retrieving the ammunition.)

title: For Sale/Trade:  LWRC M6A2 SPR
postcontent:
Ive come to the conclusion that I do not need a rifle this nice and there are other things that I would like to have, so here it is. However, let me start off by saying that I am not hurting for money or have to get rid of this, so low ballers need not apply, I know what its worth. This rifle is basicly brand new, has had 200 total rounds through it. The color is patriot brown. I have added the LWRC REPR rail system to the forend,which was an additional $150. Also included is a Troy Battle Sling, Troy rail covers, and a Magpul angled fore arm grip. Rifle also comes with the original box and paper work. I also have the LWRC guitar case that was purchased seperately from the rifle. You can no longer get these and the last one I saw for sale on Ebay sold for $150. The Aimpoint in the picture is a Comp M3 on a La Rue mount that allows it to co witness the iron sites, I also have a low profile ARMS mount for it that will also be included.

Now lets talk price and trade options. If you want the entire package Im putting a cash price of $2300. If you dont want the entire package its $2100 for the rifle and $550 for the sight and both mounts. The rifle must go before the sight. Trades I would consider are Smith and Wesson 500 (short barrell) Ruger Alaskan, Desert Eagle in brushed chrome, and perhaps something in 10mm. I can do multiple trade, trades plus cash, or just plain old cash. The pictures are the best I can do for now, the rifle looks much better in person. I cant drive to far due to my work schedule not allowing it, if your intrested let me know and we will try to work something out.
